adr_address: 70 Av. des Champs-Élysées, 75008 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Straightforward rooms & suites with flat-screen TVs, plus dining, a bar & fitness facilities.

name: Paris Marriott Champs Elysees Hotel

reviews.text: We made a stop in Paris on the way to Strasbourg for work. Unfortunately we didn’t realize it was a holiday the day we were to check out and they were securing the city.   But the staff at this hotel had our backs!  They took us out their back entrance at 5am with a bellman and all of our luggage and work cases. Arranged for a car to come in and get us and whisk us to the train station. They went above and beyond to make sure we got out before the closures and taken to catch the train. Other highlights were the amount of security and how well you were greeted each and every time you came in or out of the hotel. The bar was excellent and also took amazing care of us. Our room was clean and spacious as well. Highly recommend!

Could not imagine a better hotel! The staff are so kind and go out of their way to help.  Hannah was amazing and we looked forward to seeing her every morning at breakfast! The food is incredible (definitely get breakfast), location is awesome, rooms are beautiful - a truly wonderful stay.

The location is perfect for tourists. The rooms are a little dated, but quiet and comfortable. The service is OUTSTANDING. I must mention Hanna Kellada........nowhere in the world of Marriott have I ever met a restaurant manager/host who can match Hanna's gracious, joyful, and dedicated service... must be the nicest, most sincere person in the world. The breakfasts were very good and all staff there and at the front desk were always extremely helpful. Notable also, was Madera, for her service.

This hotel is beautiful! Jeremy, the bartender was fantastic! From the moment we checked in until we left he and his staff went above and beyond to make us feel like family during our stay! I can’t give enough praise to this staff! Thank you for helping to make our trip wonderful!

It was just OK.  Honestly I had high expectations due to the very steep nightly cost and generally glowing reviews.  It is located right on the Champs Elysees next to Sephora.  There was always an attentive doorman.  We are a well traveled family of four, two boys 9 & 11 from the States, stayed for 3 nights the end of August.  They brought us all a welcome drink at check in and some candies which was nice.  The "family room" we booked was two double beds, the room itself a decent size for Europe.  Beds were just ok comfort wise, not great.  All the family rooms, look out over the lobby.  No outside windows and this felt very claustrophobic and dark.  At check in they told us the mini bar would be refilled daily but never was the whole stay.  We are Titanium with Marriott and the breakfast was included, otherwise 50 EUR a person.  Buffet style, it was OK.  Pastries were great and everything else was underwhelming.  They are doing renovations which are slightly disruptive and the outside windows were covered in scaffolding, but generally seem to be frosted on the regular (in the breakfast area).  Unless you are coming just for shopping on the Champs Elysees or visiting the Arc de Triomphe we ubered a LOT.  To be fair, Paris is a huge city but this is not close to the major sites (Eiffel tower or the Louvre, Notre Dame).  We had one rainy day and did appreciate the ample amount of umbrellas the doormen had - though we had our own. OH, and a big annoyance was every single morning the cleaning staff would knock and then open the door straight away.  We did not have the DND sign on but I expect the briefest moment to respond to a knock.  Not given.  Also perhaps a rowdy night, I don't know, but the one evening the lobby ladies room was filthy.  One last thing, the floor of the main level lobby was super slippery on the rain day and I slipped on the wet coming in, jamming my finger in the process.  I'm really not a person to complain, I just had higher expectations for what is billed as a luxury hotel and definitely an extremely high cost.  I wouldn't stay here again, due to the claustrophobic rooms and location.
